review: Came here to eat lunch after a movie. I have a 4 year old child so I am big on the fast service. Which it wasn't. I sat there for about 5 mins or so without being helped. I didn't want to be "that table" who complained. I also know that Im not the only person on the face of the planet so of course I had to wait. The server did show up and we ordered. I got the Chinese Chicken salad. I order a full and thought it would be bigger, however it was enough for two dinners. And it was so yummy, my little me got the cheese pizza from the kids menu and we both loved it. Some of the best pizza ever. I tipped the waitress 20 percent and although I didn't see much of her, she was ok.  My only complaint was they only give you bread if you ask for it. I forgot to ask for bread and my sadly my server only came out to check on us after the food was dropped up.

The guy manning the take-out corner's name is Raccoon. RACCOON, people. He has Elvis-style sideburns, he never forgets to throw extra bread & utensils in my bag, never forgets to put extra lime cream sauce on the side when I order the chipotle chicken pizza, never forgets that I work in the complex & therefore get a nominal discount... He's awesome. How can he NOT be awesome when his name is RACCOON???!!?!  Two Thumbs Up!

I liked it. Service was good.  Food was typical CPK food.  BBQ Chicken Pizza was delicious as usual.  The smoothies are just alright.  Not too sweet.  Nothing really more I can say about this place. Make sure to validate your parking ticket.  The machine is inside in the waiting area.

great food as always. love the new stuff on the menu & josue was one of the best servers as far as attentive and funny and on point. busy location... sometimes theres a solid wait.. but definitely worth it esp with starbucks right next door for dessert ;]
CPK was a little disappointing. Service was extremely slow and the food was just okay. Was hoping it would be a little more original. Would not recommend the tortilla soup.

I had the Cesar salad...it tasted like a Cesar salad.  Brother had two soups in a bowl.  It was his usual.  Food is on the pricier side.  Thai chicken pizza was good but not superb.  They are consistent in quality.
CPK was probably once very good.  Why bother with CPK when there are some exceptional artisan wood fired pizza shops in town.

Back in 2003ish, it was one of my life goals to visit every CPK in California because I was obsessed with their Broccoli Sundried Tomato Fusilli menu item. True story. Fast forward to 2012 when I visit my local CPK (Hollywood/Highland) only to discover that it's NO LONGER ON THE MENU! I, reluctantly, ordered the Tomato Basil Spaghettini ($10.00) instead, which is spaghetti, tomatoes, garlic and basil. If this atrocity is supposed to replace the Broccoli Sundried Tomato Fusilli, then our relationship is over, CPK! It was awful. The thick red sauce was SO GARLIC-Y that it was SOUR TASTING! Never again!

CPK isn't a bad chain restaurant. I've been here a few times with friends or coworkers even though I'd prefer dining at some other places located in the Hollywood/Highland center. I normally opt for their spring rolls, the tortilla soup, a salad, and perhaps a pizza. This location is tucked in the back. They have a great patio and plenty of seating inside. You'll find it near the Starbucks. Customer service is friendly and you'll find plenty to look at while dining. I like to people watch and gawk at the tourist as they attempt to get a photo of the Hollywood sign.  Other than that, it's just a great place to go if you need an old staple or a reliable chain to eat at.

Went here recently with family and was impressed as usual by the food and service.  I am not a pizza fan usually.  Mainly because they are greasy and my tummy is not a fan of that but no one makes a BBQ chicken pizza like CPK.  It is rich in BBQ sauce, chicken is tender and a nice mix of cheese.  I take out the cilantro though cause I don't like it, the red onions are even good.   Over all for the money and the food, plus good service, I am satisfied.

It's good CPK pizza, but worst CPK ever! The problem part is the service. The place was not busy when we went there for dinner, but nobody was really paying attention, whatever I asked for I had to wait for a long time, even a glass of water or a sauce or anything! The waiters where not responsive at all... In addition they have a limited menu and don't offer most of my CPK favorites.

Sometimes it is great to have family in town. You get to hang out with people that you haven't seen in a very long time, you get to show off the fabulous town you live in, and you get to have a reason to pig out. But unfortunately one of the downsides with tourists is sometimes they want to go places that you know suck - but you have to humor them. That was our experience here yesterday. Thankfully, my boyfriends aunt gave us gift cards so we had $30 to spend which wasn't ours. Our bill came to $7 after taking the gift cards into account and I guess that that isn't too bad.  Service was the same kind of service that you would expect when everyone assumes you are a tourist. Too bad I work in this mall, and my boyfriend lives a block away. We are rather snobbish in the whole "we're not tourists and therefore demand service" aspect of things. We were seated immediately but then it took a good ten minutes to even see the patio server. He was okay, not the best. He only really stopped at the table when delivering food and drinks. When he was taking our food order (we wanted a pizza done half and half) it seemed to confuse him. He forgot our bread. We all left the table under the general impression that he was stoned.  Everyone else split the pizza which was about $11. I had the Kung Pao spaghetti which was about $10, but then to add chicken was an extra $3. I always remember it being super delicious with chicken but when it came to the table it had about 3 chunks of chicken in it (it used to be strips) and was definitely not worth the "upgrade". It was also incredibly spicy. I mean - I understand this is a spicy dish but I feel this one was overly spiced. The portion was a good size - I had enough to share at the table and take home for late night drunken leftovers.  Overall - thank the pizza gods we had a gift card! I would have been pissed if I had to throw down any more than $5 for this meal.

For having a place where you make the easiest thing, they sure do cost a lot. The food is good, but not as good for the price. Insane, service was slow, and busboys acted as they didn't know what they were doing

My family & I stopped by to eat lunch. My mom had the onion focaccia bread with grilled veggies without cheese. The grilled veggies were very flavorful.  My dad & I had the California chicken lettuce pizza.  The crust was light. The lettuce tasted fresh. There also was a couple slices of bacon which added more flavor. Service: excellent. The waitress talked to us explained the orders. Ambiance: spacious &  clean bathrooms.
Yummy food and clean bathroom.  We sat outside with a nice view of the Hollywood sign.   The server was really nice, but she took a while to refill my cranberry cooler.

A+ for food. Mis padres really think CPK is better in California. The kung pao was spicier and the salad had more avocado than we'd get out east. Excellent white pizza--so delicious. We had a great time. Highly recommended if you want to shop/tour in the area--plus they validate your parking at the H&H lot. Our server was really nice too. Well, why did I take away two stars?? Smells and wait--I don't know why but the day we went there was a smell out front. And of course, they wanted to sit us there--but they did eventually let us move. Also we called ahead and we were told there was no wait, but when we got there--there was a long (at least 15-20 min) wait.

We ate outdoors overlooking the Hollywood sign. The food was good. There is a kids menu which included the meal and a drink for about $4.99. The pizzas are large for personal size. There are also a couple of gluten free options, but not gluten free pizza.

This is a good place to eat if you're in the Hollywood & Highland area. We sat outside and a nice view of the Hollywood sign, which is always nice. It's located in the Hollywood & Highland mall, which is a gigantic 5 or 6 story shopping Mecca. Plenty of stores, food and Hollywood imitators outside. The walk of fame lines the sidewalks, and with in walking distance is Grauman's Chinese Theater. Oh, yea, the food :) My better half had a personal pizza, pepperoni and sausage which was pretty good. I have a pasta, spicy chipotle fettuccine with chi cken, was delicious also. We started off with a quesadilla which could possibly be the world's smallest quesadilla, but for $5, couldn't have expected that much, right? Ambiance is lively, so be ready for some noise. We sat outside, which was enjoyable.

Who wants Kung Pao Spaghetti! I know I do. It seems California Pizza Kitchen has become a staple every time my sister, my good friend and I celebrate the end of a busy work week. This CPK is actually very convenient as it is in the Hollywood & Highland area - the place where all the action happens! Located in the The H&H structure, parking & getting around is not at all a problem. For starters try the Spinach Artichoke dip---definitely a must! If you are craving for the nice warm bread to start, you have to ask for it as it is not something that they automatically bring to your table anymore ( great idea to avoid unnecessary waste! ) Let's get on to the food! I had the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine- great choice! The pasta was cooked to perfection, the chicken pieces - hefty & well seasoned, the sauce was creamy, buttery, with a hint of citrus - the meal was delicious!   My sister had the Kung Pao Spaghetti which she had me try - OMG! it was so good! It was the perfect twist to something we commonly think as an Italian dish! The Kung Pao spaghetti is gluten free! and for peeps allergic to peanuts, you could request it to be "off" the dish. The four cheese ravioli which my good friend had was scrumptious! (of course my fork dove in that plate too ha ha!) Little square temptations under the blanket of molten cheese and sauteed mushrooms, drizzled with fresh green basil ribbonettes, it smells fresh & rich!  Lastly, I just want to give credit to their nice waiters/servers! Having & enjoying good food is something, but to have a great server makes the whole experience delightful. Enjoy your meal!

Ive probably ate every pizza place within a mile radius on hollywood blvd and CPK always tops the cake.  This is probably the most enjoyable pizza.  Hollywood eaters this place is good.  The outside patio is a great place to sit as well.

I've had nothing but average to below average experiences at CPK. This visit was no exception. We ordered all kinds of stuff such as the Spicy Chipotle Pizza, the White, and the Five Cheese. All of them came out tasting like you'd expect from CPK, strange and kind of hard to wrap your taste buds around. Maybe my pallet isn't sophisticated enough for god awful toppings on pizza, but hey, that's just me, maybe you'll like their new pizza that's coming out. It's called singing on the toilet, because trust me, after a night at CPK, that's all your ass is going to be doing.

i dont remember the last time i was at cpk. i do know that it's been at least 3 years.  however, CPK honors veterans by offering them a free pizza & unalcoholic beverage for Veterans day so i just had to take them up on that offer (8.5 years Navy, active duty.) an air force vet of mine came along too, as well as some non vet friends (free pizza all around!)  i ordered the white pizza and friend ordered the spicy chipotle or something like that. the chipotle ended up being better than the white pizza.  the dinner was a pleasurable experience with nice staff all around. the service our smile from our waitress didnt go away once she realized that pretty much all 5 of us were eating for free. we ended up buying the pumpkin pie cheesecake just to have something to pay. our total was -35 + 7 so that was awesome and of course we tipped the full amount.
Ordered Chicken Tequila Fet. Hoping it's gonna be good The food is alright... not very happy
Good food, awesome service, very reasonable prices for Hollywood. There is nothing you can't love.

I have always loved CPK, so when I moved and found out that there was one so close to my job I was pumped. I have found in Los Angeles that there are almost TOO MANY choices when it comes to just about everything, and some days I am just so exhausted at the thought of having to decide where to eat that I skip meals all together - enter California Pizza Kitchen. CPK is my go-to when I just don't know where to go to. With such a large menu, there is always something I want to eat. My absolute favorites are their chopped salad, white pizza, and mac-n-cheese. The thing about their mac-n-cheese is that you can order the kids' size and it is still HUGE and will only run you like $6! I always add grilled chicken pieces, so it ups the price to about $9, but still you can't beat a whole meal for less than $10 that is NOT fast food. The Hollywood/Highland location is obviously in a busy location, but I have never experienced a wait. I have done take-out on multiple occasions, as well as eaten at the bar and every time I am there the servers are attentive, the food is delicious, and everything is done in a timely manner. I think one of the things that makes California Pizza Kitchen so awesome is that is reliably fantastic. I have never had a bad meal or bad experience and will definitely be continuing my patronage of this great chain and this awesome location!

Would give it a higher rating, but I hate it when the server puts a large party gratuity on a check (keep in mind we only had 5 in our group) and doesn't tell you.  I can't stand dishonesty.  The food was good though as always.  This is for the establishment in downtown Hollywood at the H&H mall area.

Service is good and food is good.  CPK is always a "safe bet" and I like some of their newer menu items.  The shrimp and zucchini fettuccini is a tasty lower calorie substitute for someone like me who enjoys the tequila chicken.  The arugula and asparagus salad is also one of my favorites; I do wish they would provide it in a meal size portion.  They also make a very good chopped salad.

I'm a huge cpk fan for over 15 years. Been to almost every location from Manhattan Beach (corporate account regular) and all OC, LA/Valley areas. Dine in and curbside pick up. Practically memorize the menu.  We were debating on driving to Umami Burger or CPK (after seeing a show at El capitan) We chose cpk since it was family friendly. The hostess with short dark hair said it'll be 25min wait, so we decided to stay. After 30min, she told us it'll be another 10-15.hmmm...since we already waited, we decided to stay. Then after 1hour, she said "you're next right after this other group".  waiting... still not being seated and noticing tons of people being called.  So I politely asked the hostess again, what's going on, we've waited well over an hour and she said "the time I gave you was just an estimate". Then I said, that I noticed several people that came after us, being called up and she said (with a slight attitude) that they are being called because they had a smaller table.  (tables of 4, 5, 6 adults i don't think is fair to be seated first!) We were 4 adults, 2 babies (both 2 yr -not in highchairs) and an infant 6months.   I do think she forgot about us, because she had too look at the OTHER paper, for our names. Or perhaps, she wasn't paying attention to who was arrived early or not. I saw tables, that could've fit our party. I was pissed and wanted to leave, but everyone was just hungry and didn't feel like driving/waiting again elsewhere.  Finally they sat us after 1hour and 35min. (in the meantime a party of 3 who arrived AFTER us, already ate and was leaving) My friend told the other male hostess about our wait, and he got the manager, who was very apologetic and comped 2 small appetizers which came out quickly.  However, with babies, time is more valuable. If the hostess told us 45min wait in advance, we would've gone elsewhere.  They labeled us as a table of 7 AND included the automatic gratuity for a large party. (the infant doesn't even eat solids) and the toddlers just ate 1 pizza crust each and boxed the rest. Ironically, after all the wait, we weren't even seated at 1 table! Our hubbies sat in a separate booth across our booth. And the "stroller" which she added as the 7th person, had to be left in the front. (she also did not mention we couldn't take the stroller to the table even though i told her we had a stroller) We tried to make the best of the night. Food tasted as expected, although the pasta was tad more al dente. The star is for the nice manager comp, and our server was attentive and nice. Otherwise, never again here at this location.

I am not a CPK fan. We went and ate up at the bar. The lettuce wraps with chicken and jambalaya were both great, and beautifully presented. The manager was very knowledgeable regarding wine pairings, and made some lovely suggestions. Now for the very best part: THE STAFF. Cameron has a winning personality, a knowledge of food and a true love of people. We had a wonderful time with both he and Raccoon. (Yes, it actually says that on his name tag). I now a huge fan of the Hollywood/Highland CPK, and of Cameron!

We waited a while before anyone came to our table to ask us for drinks or our order, however after they realized we had been waiting they made sure to take extra care of us. They brought us a free appetizer and checked on us often. Everyone was over the top nice and polite. Despite the wait in the beginning I would recommend this place to others and I will come here again.

Never again! My boss is a very generous person, and on a Thursday afternoon he decided to treat the office (of about 11 people) to Pizza and other entrees from this CPK. He got 2 small 10 inch pizza's 3 salads, a Caesar Sandwitch w/ soup and a Pesto Penne. ......the amount that food that came was an absolute joke! The sandwich wasn't seasoned.....the Soup came in a 10 ounce to-go soup cup and was less than 1/2 full!!  The charge? $120.16??? Are you crazy?  We can choose from one of many local Mom and Pop Pizzerias and get a lot more and much tastier food than this for HALF the price. A Total rip off!!! STAY AWAY from CPK!!

BBQ chicken pizza. Do i need to even say anymore in this review?? Okay. Mango Iced Tea. Convinced yet? The crappy side? it's in Highland at Hollywood, which can mean tons and tons of nightmarish traffic and pedestrians.

We were recommended to go to this place and eat their amazing pizzas. Big flop. I do not even know why they have such weird pizzas. We took Thai pizza and one with avocado and bacon. Thai pizza was disgusting. Friendly staff, however, who constantly refilling your drinks.

This time I went to a CPK, I decided to try out a pasta dish. So, of course, I picked the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. It was a'ight. My pasta was more than just al dente - it was hard and chewy. The flavor was ok, but it wasn't my jam. Service was friendly. Overall, it was nothing special. Sorry, CPK.
Amazing salads and fresh ingredients. If you don't mind the tourists walking around. The food is definitely worth! Caramelized peach salad and lettuce wraps were delicious!
chipolte chicken pizza and pink salmon are the best

The service was GREAT! the best I think i've had. the guy was so nice: he said we were his only table so we would get a lot of attention, and we were laughing cause we would just look his way and he was THERE HELPING US immediately. Really cool guy.  The pizza: What? D'jiorno's is better. lol. It wasn't hot, wasn't crisp, wasn't anything...just a little pizza for over $10. I wasn't impressed. Salad: I had some pear and nut salad, I LOVE salad and this one was great.  A little overpriced but what do you expect for Hollywood and Highland?

I have been here twice, once in 2007 and again in 2013. The location is perfect for tourists or for those passing through the Hollywood & Highland area. The food is good and there is a big selection, you can always get something different and delicious. There are great vegetarian options, which is nice. The service and atmosphere were both great. I like sitting outside and enjoying the LA weather. It's a prime people-watching location.

I'm pretty pissed about the changes to the menu, CPK. You removed the dynamite shrimp, best appetizer ever, and the broccoli sundried tomato fusilli, which was my favorite pasta dish. I think you're trying to be "healthier" or something, but it's really just depressing. But... I have to admit that I do like some of the new menu items, and the strawberry basil martini is the perfect summer drink: delicious and refreshing. As far as this location goes, even being in the tourist mecca of Los Angeles, it is a gem. The staff is all incredibly friendly and personable, and service is downright excellent. So if you still like the menu, you'll want to come to this restaurant. It may be one of the only reliable ones left at Hollywood and Highland.

Weak. Eaten here only a few times over the years. Salads were the same every time - chopped, tossed with too much dressing, tastes like something I imagine you'd get at a Crapplebee's or IwishitwasSaturday's. Same with pizzas - topping and cheese are okay but the dough is half baked: not brown, not golden, just beige and soft (not to be confused with dough-y.) Nine at night, your oven should be hot by now, right? That's just how they think pizza is supposed to be, I guess. Oven needs to be hotter on top and bottom. The dough reminded me of the  only time I ever had Little Caesar's pizza. I was at Kmart, famished, grabbed a slice out of desperation. It was junk pizza. Not saying CPK is junk pizza, but the dough (calling it "crust" is a misnomer here) is like that: bleh.  Service is good. Patio chairs are a laugh: miniature, wicker, bucket seats, sized for a child. Actually, they had to have been designed to hold a doll or a lawn elf or some other inanimate object. I'm 5'9", average weight - this chair was like sitting on a tiny, twisted, wicker-wrapped jungle gym embedded with warped, cement skeeballs. I sat down, stood right back up and requested a new chair. I puzzled as I looked around and saw other patrons contentedly squashed into these atrocities: they must've been either too afraid to speak up, in a state of shock, pain, or denial, or, most likely, they were experiencing cognitive dissonance, reasoning that it is impossible that a restaurant would furnish itself with this torturous seating device and highly improbable that such an uncomfortable chair would be designed and manufactured to begin with. Therefore - they convinced themselves - they were enjoying a perfectly reasonable, average or better, level of seating comfort. If anything, I recommend going there and sitting in a patio chair. You will never experience anything like it anywhere else. p.s. I don't like it when people from the business respond to my review with some lame appeal, but of all the 1 and 2 star reviews (there are LOTS AND LOTS) - why respond to just *one*? Is the guy a food critic or something?   Weak.

I remember when CPK first came to California - or was it born here?  Anyway, we had one in the local mall installed and it was the greatest thing since sliced bread.  Personally, I enjoy slicing my own hand-baked bread in the comfort of my own home.  I can go as THICK as I want and no one can tell me otherwise!  Then I slather copious amounts of real butter on and .... oooops ... Back to the review of CPK Hollywood ... Been here many times and it's always crowded but the wait moves along pretty quickly.  The place is clean and looks cool.  The staff are attentive and always seem to get the orders right.  I like this place, because it's a just a little teeny bit off the main drag where all the crazies are but close enough you can get your whacko fix within a minute assuming you don't stop by Papa's right down the stairway (which is a must). I'm a little angry that they got rid of the BLT Pizza!  I loved that one because the lettuce was finely chopped and the pizza tasted just like a BLT sandwich.  Yum.  Instead they killed that entree and substituted a "California Club" the waiter says.  It's just like the BLT but it also includes chicken.  Okay, what the heck?  So, out comes the pizza and it's basically a full on mixed greens salad placed right on top of the pizza.  With the BLT at least you could pick it up and eat it without having that much fall off.  These are huge pieces of lettuce that you need to cut with a knife before you can insert it in your mouth!  So, I pick up a slice as carefully as possible and at least 80% of the salad falls to the plate just as I get it in my mouth.  So, I end up having a few more slices, then grab my fork and eat my ... side salad.  Maybe it's executed nicely in the kitchen, but I doubt the chef has actually eaten this mess.  Now it was tasty, but not what I expected. The rest of the group got pepperoni pizzas and fish tacos.  All of it was great and we didn't even ask for a doggie bag this time.  Two beers and a pizza!  Buuuuurp!
Met a friend for lunch, busy busy busy...but we got right in, they move things along! The service was great and the food was really good. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

Good selection and food. The ambiance is pretty basic, but nice and open. The current special that the CPK's have called the Korean BBQ pizza is actually really, really good, but it's not exactly Korean. They cook the marinated beef into the pizza and then top it all with their own fresh version of kimchi. They use cilantro, which is not Korean at all, and because of this, if you ask for them to make it spicy, it will come out tasting exactly like Vietnamese bahn mi. IT"S AWESOME! They should just put some fresh jalapenos on the thing and call it the Bahn Mi Pie or something.

CPK is okay, but trying to do catering from this location is a mess.  We needed our order in our office by 12:30p and CPK said they would have it by noon.  They did not get it down to our runner until 12:40p and even then they were missing a pizza.  He did not leave until 12:50p!   It may be a bit farther but the Beverly Center location seems to have it together a bit more than Hollywood & Highland.   Do not try catering from here.

Decided to eat here when I was exploring the Hollywood walk of fame with a friend and had to wait for about 15 minutes to be seated as it was pretty busy. I had the spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza and found it be mostly Mexican beans and corn rather than the spicy chicken that I was expecting. I felt that that the Chipotle theme had been liberally extended to a more general Mexican theme which did not work for me. My friend had a pasta dish and said that it was bland to the extent of lacking any seasoning and I had to warn him from going overboard on the chili flakes that he was mixing in to help gulp it down. The server was friendly and service was fast considering how busy they were. Overall was not impressed and will not return in a hurry.

Since working near by I've been coming to this location a numerous amount of times. I mean just look at my check ins ;) Great service, great food, great atmosphere! Favorites: Cobb Salad: Love all the ingredients on it. All the essentials for a perfect salad. Chicken, Avocado, Tomatoes, Eggs, Bacon, Lettuce (of course) and optional beets. Chicken Tequila Fettucine: All time favorite: Linguine, Chicken , Onions and Bell peppers (I sub mushrooms). Chicken piccata-flavorful lemon,capers, spegattini, and chicken breast you'll see me again soon CPK!

Food is mediocre. Nothing outstanding but still nothing horrible. You would think the pizza to be tastier than their salads but today was not the case.  We waited fifteen minutes to get a table with several tables that would have seated our party easily in view. The hostess of the evening looked bored out of her mind and treated us with a level of disdain. Her tone was rude, sarcastic, and incredibly unappreciated.  Our waiter was polite enough but paid more attention to those around us. I might just be slightly put out, but who has a ten minute conversation about the quality of their arugula when you have other tables needing waiting on? Overall, I doubt a return will be in order.  Oh. On the bright side though the manager was quite friendly when she seated us because the hostess failed to do so.

I grew up coming to this particular CPK. I've been a fan of it ever since I was little!  Would you believe me if I said I've tried EVERYTHING on the menu? Well, I havent. I've tried most though!  Currently, my favorite dish is the Kung Pow Spaghetti with added Shrimp. They used to make it with eggs, but I believe they stopped. Honestly, I prefer it better this way!  I think the biggest and only regret I've had about a dish at CPK, was the CheeseBurger Pizza, which in fact, tasted exactly like a cheesebuger! It wasn't bad, but it wasn't something I'd want to try again, nor would I ever reccomend it. It's also off the menu now in most resturaunts. This place is VERY family friendly! It also has a great view of the Hollywood Sign!  TOURIST FRIENDLY! You must go there at least once!

I'm a frequent CPK goer - delicious food, good drinks and classic desserts! They have great specials and deals (like their $30 for two deal - one appetizer, two entrees, and one dessert for $30)!  This particular location had good service and the parking at H&H Center is convenient!

Boring food lackluster serivce.  After we are seated and water is placed the waitress doesn't even place new cutlery, there was one set on the table for 4 of us. After we ordered the food came and no paper towels or cutlery. The pizzas were boring, Pizza hut makes way better pizzas at way better price than these people. I remember eating in a CPK in Minneapolis and that had varied menu options and great tasting food  This CPK in Hollywood was horrible for 12-14 that they charge per pizza all you get is a soggy looking medium size pizza that doesnt even taste good. This is the last time I'll ever take anybody to a CPK ever!
Food was good service was a little separator an the server wasn't that attentive. Wanted dessert and she never came back after dropping bill.

Our family recently ate at this CPK on a trip to Graumens Chinese Theater and could not have been any happier with the service and food. The manager and server went out of their way to find anchovies for a pizza that we ordered. The BEST CPK we have ever been to and by far the best staff our family had the pleasure to order from!!! These are great people!

One of my favorite BBQ chicken pizzas but def a little too pricey for what it is. Don't know if it's the location (Hollywood) but always seems like I spend more then I think I would just for some pizZa. I do love there gluten free BBQ chicken too which is usually what I get when I do go.

Me and a friend of mine cane here to eat dinner before watching a premiere screening of The Hobbit.  As we walked in,  the host came right up to us and introduced himself and sat us to the table.  I ordered the full chinese chicken salad and my friend ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti.  The salad was delicious and big.  I was full after eating my salad.  His spaghetti was good.  The waiter was great and the service was great.

3.5! I love CPK amongst the ranks of chain restaurants! They offer a great reward program for returning customers. The prices are a little high, but the food is decent. I had the BBQ chicken pizza. I enjoyed every bite! Service was as good as expected. There is nothing special enough about CPK to give it 4 stars!

The bf and I were hungry and we live a block away. I thought hey I've been to Cpk a million times so it's a safe bet.  Wrong  We ordered the spinach and artichoke pizza from our waiter and asked to add tomato and chicken. We figured a salad to start would satisfy us in the mean time so we ordered the Ceaser.  About fifteen minutes had passed and the waiter came out with our Ceaser salad... Literally one minute later the pizza came without the tomatoes and we had to ask for our Parmesan and red peppers... I dunno I thought that was weird considering it's Cpk and we ordered a pizza.  Sooo then I bit into the pizza and stopped after two bites. Literally whole chunks of artichokes and full on spinach slapped on some pizza dough. I thought maybe it would be like a spinach and artichoke dip/sauce... Wrong huge disappointment. I love spinach and artichoke dip, but not spinach and artichoke on bread with no flavor. Two thumbs down on this experience but I'll be back to give another try and another review.

Wait times were horrendous. We ordered three cheese ravioli, Jamaican thin crust pizza and another thin crust with artichokes. Everything was just okay. Nothing extraordinary. Oh and did I say the wait times were horrendous??

This is my second time visiting this location. It's CPK so you're expectations can't be too high.  My friends and I cruised in on Thursday and there was no wait time so that was good.  We ordered the Chipotle Chicken and the White Pizza with Bacon.   Both pizzas were good.  Are they overpriced?  Yes.  But you know that before even coming here.  The main reason we went to CPK wasn't even for their pizza actually.  Say what???  That's right...we came because they have this amazing butter cake topped with ice cream.  OH YES!!!  That is delicious. The service was OK.  The waiter looked like he'd rather be doing something else...but I don't blame him...I would too.

I recommend ordering anything BUT the pizzas at CPK (super ironic). Seriously though, the pizzas I've tried are just too salty and the dough is not good at all. If you do want pizza, I've tried the Blanca flatbread which was better than their regular pizzas in my opinion. The BEST item on their menu is the chicken tequila fettuccini!! And the BBQ chicken salad is tasty as well! These two dishes alone make up for the higher rating.  Don't forget to get your parking validated (it will be $2 for 2 hrs) More like 3 and a half, but giving 4 stars only because of some good memories (went to cpk often freshman year of college because it was close enough to easily gather large groups).

Really nice bar service. We decided on lunch at the bar. It was actually comfortable even though we sat right next to the "Take out" counter part of the bar...during lunch. The chubby, strawberry blonde Queen who works at the bar is such a pleasure! He was so nice and always smiling! Loved him and he made our experience even better at CPK. My last experience at CPK in OC was just as nice. They really spend time on their training of their staff. Never a bad experience.

I have been going to CPK since i was little and i used to love it! But since 2007, the quality of the food and the portions have diminished. I have never seen a restaurant cut so many corners. I ordered chips and guacamole to go and the guacamole was so small, filled with mostly cheap corn and other fillers. It didn't even taste like avocado. FILLER FOOD: that's what you can expect now at CPK. And of course they're always trying to push the drinks on you because that's how they make the bulk of their money. Cheap booze mixed with cheap filler sugary liquids. You've disappointed me, CPK! Two stars only because the place seems clean

Me & my crew come to this CPK location A LOT. One of the best places near the school. The service is cool, they're nice & they're fast.. It's usually crowded if you come anywhere from 12-2. It's kinda hard to find but it's on the top floor of the plaza. We all usually get the Jaimican Jerk Chicken, oh man, it's SOO good..

i had a good experience here, but it was more because of the service than the food itself. our server was super nice, really gave us a run down of our options, and even offered me a refill on soup. the food itself was, well, 3 stars. the tortilla soup was good but certainly not the best i've ever had. the white pizza was the perfect size for 3 of us, but mediocre on taste. the garlic and bacon were about all i could taste. i'd go back. it's right for the price, and the experience is good. but i'd probably get something different. they do have a lot of options, so i'd recommend trying the place out for yourself.

I really enjoyed my experience at this CPK location. The hosts were super friendly and even though there was a wait, they kept checking in with us to make sure we were up-to-date with what was going on at our table. I am a BBQ chicken salad aficionado and this one really was delicious. I wish i could have it for lunch every day. Our server was super friendly and professional. She knew I was in a time crunch and got my check out as fast as she good. I am only docking one-star because the food took about 5 minutes longer than it should have. Not my servers fault, though.

I have been to this CPK location with a friend twice during my stay in LA (and we only stayed for 2 days). We just loved it! The first time I took a Caesar salad which was tasty and filling. The second time I went for the Chipotle pizza. It was very spicy but still very good. I would definitely take it again.

CPK, is another place that for me, is consistently inconsistent. I can have an awesome experience one day, then an absolutely awful one on my very next visit. It's not just the service, but the food quality and it's something I don't understand, seeing as CPK is a chain, and consistency is something that should be standard, no matter what the location is.  I understand service can be hit or miss because sometimes people are just off. However, in this case, it must have been staff shortage because for some reason, our server had a very large station and several large parties. That left me and my friends constantly looking around for her, or for anyone for that matter - for service.  I don't know if the food quality is on me - or the chefs, as I didn't like my dish at all. I decided to try the Kung Pao Spaghetti and not only was it bland, there was no reason for the words 'Kung Pao' in the name because it wasn't spicy at all either. I'm sure it didn't help that I had just gotten back from China and was hoping for something more authentic and flavorful as the foods I enjoyed while there.  Anyway, my friends were equally unhappy with the experience but if history plays out - the next time I dine at a CPK, everything should be ok, at the least if not great.

Ssssssllllllllooooooowwwwwww service!. We sat at our table for over 15 minutes as servers, waiters, and even mangers passed by our table without even making eye contact much less take a drink order or tell us they would be right with us. We finally grabbed one of the waiters and asked who our server was. He said he didn't know but would take our order in a moment. I would be more understanding if they were really busy but they were not and 15+ minutes was ridiculous even if they were. The bad service continued with slow food arrival, and refills were none existent. The only thing that arrived in a timely manner was the check. The food at CPK is always consistently good so we didn't have a problem with that.

Three stars indeed. Chain restaurants like this are why other countries laugh at us. That said, the food isn't half-bad if you have unadventurous friends who like the consistency (yawn) of a mainstream chain restaurant. It's fine. Just fine. No more than fine. But fine.

GLUTEN FREE - This is one of the best places to stop and grab a bite to eat while walking the stars! Not only is it $5 to $7 cheaper per entree than Hard Rock Cafe, but once you make your way up the stairs there is a lookout where you can clearly see the "HOLLYWOOD" sign & take pics! BE AWARE: those metal ledges get HOT, so don't lean on them for your pics!  I shared a GF pizza with a friend that wasn't GF and she could hardly tell the difference! We also split their cobb salad which was great!!  We got the artichoke dip as an app & it was pretty amazing also, though not GF!  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you get hungry while perusing the walk of stars!!

Where to start... The turn around time is S L O W... Many open tables and people standing outside for no reason. When I was finally seated, our server came and took our drink orders. I stated I was ready to order but he was already on his way getting our drinks. The funny part was that he came back with wrong drinks. In a hurry to get the drinks but didn't properly hear what drinks. HAH! He then went to get the drinks we ordered... When he came back I FINALLY ordered...  1. Chips and Gauc - White and blue chips with white corn guacamole. It wasn't bad.. Nothing special though. I don't know if I'll get it again. 2. The works pizza -  Disappointed... Almost like frozen pizza from the toaster oven. Will NOT get again! 3. The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad - I love this salad!!! I got the full and added avocados for an additional $2.60. Because of their SLOW service, I was late to a show and had to togo the rest of my food. Never coming here even with an hour and 30 minutes to spare!

So my friends and I were on our way to the Hollywood Bowl and needed some food to take up the hill.  I called CPK about 20 minutes before we were getting to Hollywood and Highland.  The employee was very kind and took my order over the phone.  I told her I would be there in 20 and she said perfect.   I walked in and went straight to the take out counter.  The cashier asked if I was Chris and I said yes.  Must have been the only to-go order.  But everything was ready.  She even remembered that I requested extra bread and butter.  She threw in some cheese and peppers for the thai chicken pizza I got too.  My bf ordered the kung pao spaghetti.  While we didn't really eat the food for at least a half hour when we got into the concert, the food was still warm.   Everything was tasty.  The chain is pretty consistent.  Not the most amazing pizza I have every had, but definitely worth the price for prompt service.  I think I have eaten at this location once before, but when I went in, it was really crowded.  Definitely recommend the to-go option.  Then go out and enjoy the crazy sights at the Hollywood and Highland complex.

I There was 5 of us eating here.  Service was very slow.  We waited over 25 minutes before we got our appetizers and at the same time my grandson got his main course.  We did not get refills on our drinks.  I would not recommend this place.  I gave 2 stars instead of 1 because the food was good.  I gave the waitress my credit card to pay for the check and when she came back with the credit card slip I noticed she did not give me back my card.  My daughter went to the waitress to ask for the card back she pulled it out of her back pocket.  I don't know if it was an honest mistake but I thought it was weird.
We went here for lunch and when they gave us our plates they were not washed or clean.  The plate still had leftovers from a previous visit on them.

Came here for lunch and it was not a great experience. The hostesses were outside standing talking about some drama in the restaurant. I arrived and stood there right in front of them and no one greeted us until I said "hi. Table for 2?" And then one looked at me and said "ok." And kept talking. Until they finally sat us, she didn't mentioned any specials. She just mumbled something then walked off. Totally rude. Then the server came and greeted me. She was nice. But the food was not good. I got the pesto penne. It was dry, and the pasta was hard. Would not recommend. Bad experience at this location. And By the way, they do not have garlic bread.

I love CPK but this place is more for tourist rather than locals. But nevertheless sevice here is always amazing. Food is fast and has great selections of pizza. For locals try avoiding weekends for it gets a bit crowded. This place is really good with kids and group of friends. So come on down. If your a sweet tooth. Try Salted Caramel Pudding.. Heaven!! But personaly I love their Tiramisu. Soft, delicate pair with coffee!
Seated immediately on my lunch break. Though hectic inside and out I received my 4 cheese ravioli shortly after ordering. It was great.
Our California Club pizza was delicious..waiter Baldric was helpful and not pushy at all. Salted Caramel pudding also equally delicious and served in fun container...yum!
Dont ever come here.  Good place for kids but service sucks.  Waiting here 20 mins not busy, they put all the new tables with one server.  Dont come here

My first time here and it was pretty good!  Got a small plate for free for signing up for something and split their original pizza, and all in all, was pretty cheap.   Not blown away by anything, so I deducted a star.   And it's a chain,  So I deducted another. But, other than that- sure, if you've never been,  pop on in and try it out.
Had a really good pizza. The California Club, loved the mix of bacon with the fresh avocado and tossed salad.

After taking my son and his friend to a movie at the El Capitan Theater we ventured across the street to Hollywood and Highland.  The kids wanted CPK we hunkered up to the counter and were greeted by a very friendly waitress.  The food was par for the course in terms of CPK...middle of the road...good.

We waited over 30 minutes for a take away pizza to be told that the salad toppings have been left off for us to put on there ourselves. So it took half an hour to cook a pizza with some cheese on it. The pizza tasted pretty bland as the ingredients hadn't been cooked together. What a joke!

I would avoid this location if possible. It's filled with noisy tourist groups. There were large tables of multiple families with squealing children.  Unsupervised children playing in the aisles surrounded us while we tried to eat dinner before going to a movie at the Chinese IMAX. The food at this location is also not up to par with other CPK locations. The server was great, and we got our food in a timely manner, but we won't be going back.
Love their ginger dumplings! Also tried their new chicken avocado egg rolls...not so good. You only taste the greasy/fried wonton. Service was pretty slow which kept me from giving them 5 stars.
I love this place!!!! It's close to my house... I eating there evry day.. The people are nice and the pizza is amazing...
As usual, amazing pizza.  Little advice, if you are not doing a simple pick up and want to sit then you better make a reservation!

Pros- Smiling servers Not a long wait time Good food Nice interior Noise lvl is ok Cons- Complimentary whatever the last person ate with my knife(see picture) Bread came after the pizza? Wow ok Tables are set up so you bump with whoever is sitting behind you (get the booth) Second time here and my response is "meh"

It was a Wednesday evening when we came to eat here. The husband and I have been to a few CPK places, and weren't disappointed until this visit. I know this is in a tourist area, but that being said you'd think the service would be better. It wasn't crowded at all when we came here for dinner around 7. Our waiter didn't really check on us, nor did he ever refill our drinks. Just took our drink orders and then food orders. There were a few times when I could see him standing with other waiters just joking around to the right of the bar. I noticed other patrons looking around a bit for their waiter as well.  Pizza we had was so-so. Pepperoni pizza the kids ordered was super greasy. Waiter didn't check on us to ask how our food was and after the food came out the only other time we saw him was when he brought the bill. I do try and take things into consideration when it comes to servers, but it was obvious the wait staff would rather joke around than serve the guests. Really sad.

We visited CPK on a Saturday afternoon at about 1pm in the busy Hollywood and Highland Center.   We were seated promptly.  This restaurant appears to be much smaller than your typical CPK; however, everything was efficient. We ordered a pizza and a salad to share.  The food was well presented, colorful, and delicious.  We received the food very quickly.  I liked the open kitchen concept, and the fact that you can see the pizzas being made from the main portion of the restaurant. The one star deduction is because the server knew nothing about the loyalty program when we had questions, and she said "we don't really know anything about it either".   Other than that, I would likely return again to this location.
Williams was great! It was a very busy night but he still took care of us promptly and yes the food was great specially the moroccan-spiced chicken!
I got the artichoke pizza and the butter cake which was SOO good, I don't wen want to know the calories, will definitely be returning for lunch again this week

Went here with my dad we both got pizza and it was delicious. They are very pricey for what you get, but it does seem upscale and we didn't have to wait really for our food . I recommend it if your looking for good pizza and want to got some place nice...

It's a good thing I enjoy the food here so much because the employees aren't that pleasant. My server was nice and I can't complain, he just seemed not overly stoked to be at work on a Saturday. I can't blame him. My real issue was the hostess. I came in to have a nice lunch by myself and she tried to have me sit at the bar in one of those tall chairs. Normally, I'd totally go for this but today I just wanted a comfortable seat by myself. Rather than take a whole 4 person booth, like she tried to direct me to, I politely asked if I could take a small 2 seater in the corner to which she cheerfully responded, "well sure. You've already made up your mind."  My food was good, but because of her passive aggressive comment, my lunch was a little less enjoyable.  Thanks for being so rude.

Great location, great people watching (even though they'll probably be tourists).  The food is exactly the same as you'd get in any other CPK, so I'm not going to go on and on.  I always order the same thing: California Club with chicken and extra lettuce.  Be sure to have CPK validate your parking ticket.

This location at Hollywood and Highland is located right next to the Starbucks in the back.  They must have changed their menu because I was looking forward to ordering a specific dish and it wasn't on it.  Oh well.  My dining companion and I decided to split a half salad and a pizza.  We opted for the Moroccan spiced chicken salad and the 5-cheese and tomato pizza.  We also ordered a red sangria and a Newcastle beer.  The drinks arrived first, followed by the salad and pizza.  Our server also brought us some plates to divide up the food.  The salad was really good.  It had dates, dried cranberries, spiced chicken, beets, bell pepper, spring mix lettuce, almonds, avocado, chopped eggs and butternut squash.  It was one heck of a salad.  It was really tasty and I really enjoyed all of the different textures.  I really enjoyed the sweet and the savory combinations too.  The salad gets 4 stars in my book.   The pizza was cooling as we ate our salad.  It was delightful but nothing special.  3 stars.  Our service was great, as we arrived when it wasn't too busy.  The host seated us on the patio as requested, and we enjoyed the warm LA weather.  Luckily the restaurant was in the shade or else we would have asked to be seated inside.  This is a solid place to eat at with large groups because there is something for everyone.

2015 YELP 100 CHALLENGE - 036/100 Not the best location I've been to, unfortunately. But this place is packed all the time because of the location so I guess it's expected. I got the spicy chicken pizza which was completely soggy. My friend's pasta was really tasteless too. And the spinach & artichoke dip came with totally stale chips. They were hard, couldn't even bite into them!

This could have easily been a one or two star experience if it hadn't been for Steve the manager, who made sure that the wait staff corrected our order ( we came with a large group and there was some confusion) ; he also made sure that we got our drink orders in time as well.   Outside of this, the product coming out of this kitchen was actually, surprisingly good....delicious, I'm even tempted to say...  everything from the salads to the jambalaya to the pastas were outright well executed, none overseasoned, and the ingredients noticeably fresh and of good quality.   In a touristy area near the Manns Chinese theatre, this place has lots of foot traffic so don't expect a quiet dinning experience. A good option for a sit-down lunch or dinner if you're visiting the area.   A big thanks again to Steve the manager for making sure our night ended on a good note.
Came here family night with my kids n husband once loved there variety of pizza menu grate food good friendly service.

I was happily surprised of the quality of appetizers and pizzas enjoyed by our family at the California Pizza Kitchen.  They also had a pretty good wine list.  Service was pretty good.   Try to eat outside on their patio and watch the people walk by.

Reason why I giving one star is because it's been 30 minutes since I ordered my food, service it's really bad !! Waitress all over walking like they don't know sh**t Finally I decided to leave without no one notice, seems they don't care if you leave or stay

If I can give this place a zero I would totally do it I have gone multiple  times expecting CPK to redeem themselves and every time I go in either the pasta is hard and I have to send it back or the pizza has the wrong ingredients it always something wrong when I come here. I seriously like the good CPK has to offer but at this location it's a horrible dining experience. Don't come here it's a disappointment to the CPK brand

location: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA
review: Wow I just told the server to turn off the heater and he said something weird and he couldn't so disappointing.
I love the salads in this place! I always try a different one and I am never disappointed! They are big though! I always order half bowl.

1st. Time at CPK, service was great!! But, the food was not. I don't think I'll be back; we order Peperoni pizza, spaghetti Bolognesse, and spinach fetuchini tequila and lime. Honestly only the pizza was ok, pasta looks good but the taste was like when you cook at home something for the 1st time, (looks ok but no taste...) taste mire like frozen food; looks ok but wirh no taste at all. Note when I came back to my hotel I mentioned to the front desk people, and they told me; " I'm so sorry! I didn't know you guys will eat out... Food there is horrible... Next time I will recommend a really good place. A place do I go for dinner. (Shocking!!)

Poor customer service. One employee told me they do deliver waited on hold for 10mins to be transfer to someone that told me they don't deliver, even when the recording & live person said they did. Went in & the manager couldn't even give me a straight answer as to why I was told two different things & didn't even tell me if they deliver or not! How don't you know?? Seriously your the manager! Crazy! Smh. How do these people get hired ?

Some of the worst bubbly I've had. Coke was watered down, poorly portioned. Ice cubes dominated the space inside my glass, very little carbonation. Sadly, everything else in accompaniment to my coca cola made for an even worse meal. *Note that my written review for Coke is stand alone and separate from the star rating. I use the star rating system for my overall experience. But I only choose to verbally review the Coca Cola Classic...because it's classy.

Full bar! Great airy vibe if you sit on their patio on a nice day. Hwood sign in the bkgd & good ppl watching. Lunch special is a great price but not great food compared to the rest of the menu. If you download their app and give them your user ID number you can get a FREE "small plate" from their menu.

Great service! Good food...definitely get the Thai chicken, tostada chicken or BBQ chicken pizzas. Salads are really good too. Seems like they have moved away from their basic menu by adding things like lobster and steak. I would go to other places for those items...but the pizza is still really good, especially with the wheat crust.

Asked for an outside table and hostess pointed to table that needed cleaning. We said fine. Next thing we knew, someone else was getting the table. We did not understand so we asked for the manager. I explained to the manager & said I felt discriminated against. The hostess blurted out "REDNECK" and stormed away. WHAT....Must have hit the nail on the head

I work in the area and eat here a lot.  recently the restaurant seemed to go through a bit transition, not only the interior, but also with staff.  I like the new menu, despite my favorite dish (chicken chimichuri) being removed.  I like the tables, it is better than the banks of booths they had causing awkward walking flow through the restaurant. my complaint is about the service.  3 weeks ago, our waitress was touchy feelie and making weird jokes and did not seem to get the vibe that we were talking and her jokes were weird and uninteresting to us and interrupting our conversation. she thought one of my friends was sleeping, he wasn't his eyes were open, and then called him sleepy the rest of the meal.  the service was quick, and she was attentive, but her table chatter was off putting and weird. a week later i go in,  the service was non existent.  the server came to the table to ask if we wanted refills, but coworker and i said yes.  only i got a refill.  my 2 coworkers were waiting for 20 minutes to try and flag down a server to get a refill.  we also ask for check.  he runs off before hearing us ask for a split bill.  he drops off check and drinks in to go cups. again disappearances for 20 minutes. he splits the check and we wait, yes you guessed it again 10 minutes before i flagged him down and got him to take out payment. i lost my cool a little bit at the end, i just wanted to leave and every time he left the table i was scared he would never come back.  the music was loud, i had a headache.  i would have gotten a dessert for my birthday if we hadn't waited so long for drink refills.   this ended up being a 2+ hour lunch, half of which was trying to find waitstaff for things. i don't feel like i have time enough to eat here now on my lunch breaks because the service is so uneven.
The pizza looks more as a focaccia but not bad! It's on 15$ each plus tips, it's just small portion!

At CPK at bar and ginger bearded Curtis and Cameron are running rings around pig and whistle on service and personality!  Yes I know it's a chain. Yes I know you can get it anywhere else in the city. But here you get it really really good! Having chicken lettuce cups and strawberry basil martinis. Now it's on.....

Stopped in to have a late lunch. Was greeted right away as we approached the check in booth, I requested to be seated on the patio and was immediately walked to our table. The host was quick to re-clean the table for us as we sat down. Our server, Victoria was friendly, upbeat, polite and kept us well taken care of. The patio was checked regularly and cleaned as each table was cleared. Not sure about the interior as we did not go inside but the outside was clean and well maintained. The food came out fresh and hot and was delicious. I ordered the Thai pizza and the baby ordered crispy chicken and broccoli and we both loved our dishes. Great spot to enjoy the breeze and a great meal.

Good food and our waiter was nice but the hostess with the big hoop earrings was just rude and tried to be snarky in a slick way. It was our first time at the restaurant and we were not sure if we had to seat ourselves or wait. Every where's different. So after waiting a couple minutes outside, we went inside to check and the hostess came up and got mad at us for walking in. We understand that there is only "one of her", as she said herself, but in no way were we trying to be rude or be a pain. We just were not sure how the seating went. It's crazy how one bad attitude can affect the entire meal especially when we were not rude towards her once. She was the first one to come off that way.

This restaurant is definitely going through a transition.  It seems as if it is separating itself from the family booth style and replacing it them with reclaimed wood square tables, going for the italian and rustic feel.  It's not bad at all, it actually gives the restaurant a fancier vibe, I just miss the comfy booths (because I am lazy and like to spread out), haha.  The menu has gotten fancier, now offering halibut, healthier options and other items you would not find at CPK two years ago.   Now the reason for the low rating: My husband and I got our main entree, a BBQ chicken pizza, 45 minutes after ordering.  Although our waitress was sweet, the service was super slow and the restaurant was not busy.  Yeah, I know, it's CPK.  Keep your expectations to a reasonable level, Amanda.... But, I mean, if you are part of a chain that mass produces these on the daily, it shouldn't take that long for a pizza.  AM I RIGHT?!?!

This is a chain pizza restaurant that offers some really creative and delicious meal options. There pizza is really well done and in addition they have other great options like steak, salads and pasta.  We were visiting the Hollywood area and found this place in a high end mall next to the Chinese theater. We sat outside with a view of the Hollywood sign and had a great lunch. The servers were attentive and not too pushy and the restaurant was comfortable, clean and pleasant.  We ordered the Thai pizza, Jerk chicken and another and devoured them all. They have a limited selection of beers and although there drafts are pricey at $7, it was worth it. Their flavored ice teas and frozen lemonade is a great choice too.  The bill came to about $70 so it does add up quickly. We definitely could have shared a pizza and they have affordable lunch options. Like pizza with soup or salad.  It's a great choice you won't regret it.

The staff here was really nice, especially our waitress. They brought us out free guacamole and chips because it was our first time there. I enjoyed the food a lot. Overall it was a really good experience and I would go back!

You know exactly what you're getting with CPK, but this location is a step up from others we've been to. A recent renovation has done well by this place. It looks and feels modern, and (shockingly) the new ribeye steak was as good as many I've had in steakhouses in LA at twice the price. But I wouldn't have bothered to review if we hadn't recently had an outstanding experience with a server names Abbie. She was top-notch, definitely exceeding our expectations for service in a quick casual chain like this. Thanks so much, Abbie!

My coworkers and I decided to have lunch at CPK. We were greeted by a really friendly hostess only to be served by rude servers. All the servers were indifferent and seemed really unhappy. Next time, I think i'll order take out and eat it in the office.
Our waiter Frankie was super accommodating. It was such an extremely hot day and he kept the drinks coming and even gave us a to go cup!!! Wonderful! Thanks Frankie

I come here every Friday . Every single time I come here with my friends , we receive the best customer service . Everyone in this staff goes beyond in excellent customer service . I'm not into chain restaurants but I come here for convenience. I keep coming here because the food is always good & the staff here rocks ! As I'm sitting here I decided they deserve an awesome review . You could tell the manager here must treat there staff right . Thanks for the excellent customer service !

I was there for a dinner with my three kids (4, 2 and 6months) on a Saturday evening. I totally understand that it is not the best timing nor best place to have dinner with three kids. However, regardless of that my experience at the restaurant was overall very satisfactory. Actually, the beginning of the service was very poor. After being seated in an outside seating, I was able to get my drink order very quickly. After that, I had to wait quite some time to be attended to put my dinner order. Not sure how long it took but easily felt like 10-15 minutes as I was watching other customers who came later than us were served. I claimed that I was unattended and then immediately a server named Frankie came to attend us. After that everything was fabulous. A very sincere apology followed by a nachos appetizer on the house. My two simple orders (Hawaiian Pizza and Bolognese Pasta) came instantly! Thanks Frankie!

Monday night, my girlfriend and I were looking for quick bite before a concert at the Greek Theater.  We pulled up a couple seats at the bar and we were quickly greeted by the bartender, Dallas. We let him know we were in a hurry for the show and he helped guide us to some menu item that could quickly come out.  Through out the service he checked up on us and everything was very smooth.   Service was 5 stars.

The restaurant is located in the Hollywood and Highland shopping centre; perfect spot to take a photo of the Hollywood sign on level 4. Unfortunately at night time it was not lit up. The service was great, the lady who looked after our table was amazing, polite, helpful and made sure the whole family is ok. I bought the Salmon, it was over clocked and without skin. The corn and capsicum were nice.. Over all it was an enjoyable main. My daughter bought the crunchy Thai salad, She liked it and I liked the taste. The kids had macaroni and cheese.. Was nice too. The over all experience was satisfactory.

Do not get the crispy Mac and cheese, it's not what we thought it would be and its kinda gross. The rest of the food was pretty good though. The thing I don't understand is that it appears that some tables get free bread, but some others don't. That doesn't make sense. Our waiter was very frustrating, we couldn't understand what he was saying and he was trying way too hard. He was trying to force us to buy alcohol and dessert which is annoying if you'd already said no. His attitude really put a downer on the experience. The food came out quickly and the pizzas were awesome.

Amazing place. Got the halibut and honestly have not had a meal this delicious in a VERY long time. Our waiter Scotney was caring, attentive, and truly on point! The manager Luis visited our table for a bit of small talk which made us feel right at home. We will defiantly be coming back not just for the food but the great service as well thanks Scotney!

Last night my friends and I decided to have an adventure and go to CPK. We had a long, stressful Friday at work and were in need of delicious food & a strong drink(s).  When arriving at CPK we were immediately greeted by a beautiful southern gentleman named, Clinton. Although he was our server, not the host, he still took the time and showed us to our table. Having suffered a painful looking injury to his finger (possibly broken?) it didn't affect his mood in the slightest. He was upbeat, conversational, knowledgeable about the menu, and overall it was clear that he was making an effort to provide excellent service. We ordered the tortilla spring rolls, specifically the Mediterranean veggie and Baja chicken. Both were great, the perfect nosh to keep us tied over until our main course, the artichoke and spinach pizza. The pizza was cooked perfectly and although it was nowhere near a NYC slice, it was still pretty satisfying. Throughout the meal we ordered mojitos and the blueberry ginger smash. Both were tasty! Clinton provided perfect bedside manner throughout our dinner. His southern twang and impeccable service made our night. He was one of the best servers I've had since living in LA!  A huge thanks to Clinton for a wonderful experience! xoxo CPK Girl

So we decided to have a nice birthday lunch for my brother. So far my experience has been horrible. Our waiter tintin does not care to give us attention what so ever. Another waiter had to get our drink order. Then we waited awhile for tin tin to get our food orders. We asked for bread, took awhile for that to get to our table. We asked again if the bread was coming and he said it's being freshly baked but when it got to our table it was cold and chewy. Pretty sure it wasn't fresh. I will be never returning to this location ever again.

I've been to this location twice now and I have been pleased with my experience.   Both visits were in the afternoon at slightly off dining times (around 2pm), but we were promptly seated and greeted by an efficient server. The food has been fresh and delicious.  I am a big fan of the pizza and my husband likes the full size salads.  I would recommend visiting, especially if you don't have a California Pizza Kitchen in your area.

This place only gets a star reviews because I love CPK but definitely not this one. If I could, I would give -2 stars. The service was horrible. We received our food but received dirty silverware. When we asked for it to be replaced it took the FOREVER to bring us back clean silverware. By the time we got our clean silverware, the food was cold. So we got to enjoy cold food. Staff seemed a little unorganized.. Won't be coming back.

The service was just awful. We only saw our waiter a few times and had to ask different waiters for things several times just so we could get some help. We got our utensils and they had chocolate all over them. it took us a good 10 minutes just to get another set and we had to go through 3 people to finally get them. None of us plan to come back here again.
Great service, food good. Sat outside looking at the hollywood sign. Great place to eat b4 concert at Hollywood bowl, shuttle picks up at this mall.

We found this place accidentaly in our walk exploring the area. The food was actually delicious. Don't normally have pasta dish outside my house, however they actually brought me the pasta "al dente" as requested. Yum. Waiter was friendly and attentive. Nice location away from the madness of the boulevard. Great to be able to sit outside and enjoy the view of the Hollywood sign.

I was a fan of this place until the other day. I will NEVER go back in there. Our waiter approached us laughing at some inappropriate comments made with the other coworker and couldn't even take our order right. kept saying is that it before we could finish our order!!  And worst of all walked away before the last one of us placed an order.  How rude!!!! Customer service is the face of your business, how can it not be a priority! I just can't understand specially in this location.  Pizza was waiting back there for a while before we received it because again there was more talking among employees than working. Cold pizza:  The worst!!  I hate cold food. I expected more. I give up on not just this location but all of them.  I had family visiting. How embarrassing.   You've lost my business and everyone else's I can earn about this.

It was my first time in LA and my first time at CPK. I learned it is a chain restaurant. The pizza I had was really good. I got a special pizza of the week. A Thai pizza with chicken, bean sprouts, sweet chili sauce and more asian ingredients. I really liked it. My girlfriend had a very delicious salad with avocado and artichokes. Drinks wer ok too, price above average. I would go there again.

The pizza is delicious and the crust is amazing!! Nice and crispy on the outside and chewy like rice cakes on the inside! I ordered a Hawaiian pizza and it's One of the best pizzas I've ever had. Next time I will ask them for more onions tho! The service was really good too.
I love this place. It never fails me.  The staff is courteous,  the food is great and the music is soulful!

Great place and food always consistent, My family love this place. We always come here at least 2-3 time a month and with menu selection for kids. They never complain if I want to come to this place. Service always good and food always great!!  Definitely come back again and again

My family and I went to CPK after the performance of the Nutcracker. It was very busy, but our waiter(sorry forgot your name) was amazing!!! We had a party of 8 and they treated us like we were the only ones there. The food came out hot and delicious!! The drinks were cold and spot on! What a great experience!!  Thank you for making the night even more amazing!!!
Pizza was good but service was extremely horrible. No straws, no napkins or utensils. And no refills! Had to ask for everything to another server. Not planning on coming back to this place!

Great service and Great food! Our waiter Johnny was very attentive and gave us great recommendations from the menu! It seemed he geniuenly cared about us having a great experience and taste for the food. We had a small snafu, but the manager made it right.. Would Definetly go back.

I wanted to write a review specifically for the service. I've eaten at CPK for many years and always love the BBQ chicken salad with avocado and the pizza. The food is always good and the iced tea is my fav. The only thing is that they've recently changed their table bread recipe and I'm not very fond of the new one. As I said, this is a review of the service. We had Clinton as our waiter and could not be happier. The place was slammed since it is a Saturday and during the holidays but he was still nice, polite, quick and remembered everything we requested (water with no ice and the lemon, for example) He made sure to wish us a happy new year and didn't let us walk out with getting a validation. I was very pleased with his attitude and how well he knew the menu. Excellent service, thank you Clinton!

I have eaten here many,  many  times, I always bring tourists here as Hollywood and Highland is a great place for visitors...I have ALWAYS received GREAT service and GREAT food each and every time!! I had forgotten to get my parking receipt validated, and when I ran back even though they were closed the waitress came to the door took my ticket and validated it! Now THATS what I'm talking  about! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

CPK is a safe place to eat.  You will always find something to eat but don't expect anything spectacular.   One of the best things at CPK is free - the bread.  The baguettes are fluffy on the inside and crunchy on the outside.  Served warm, dip these babies in the olive oil concoction and enjoy! The Chinese chicken salad is mediocre at best.  The chicken is salty and they toss it in dressing, but then put another teriyaki-type glaze again on top.  Super over-sauced =( This location in the Kodak theater is huge.  There's outdoor seating and bar seating as well.

i honestly thought it was goin to be good but sadly my order was missing stuff . it defenitly wasn't worth what i payed & i couldnt go bck because of my break time. i thought it was goin to be better but no. not ordering food from here anymoree

My girlfriend and I decided to come to this CPK after a few games of bowling. As we entered our host took us to our table. Because we were only a party of two, we felt we would rather sit next to each other. Almost immediately our Server relocated us to a big ass booth. But thats not the main point. As we sat down we were greeted by Clinton. First things first, Clinton had such an amazing attitude, bringing smiles to us both. He had excellent service and treated us like royalty. Our food came promptly and he was very patient with us. As we finished up he ran over some to-go boxes and our bill. We quickly paid the bill, and helped clear the table. He thanked us and exchanged a quick conversation. Absolutely an  A++++ server, and i cant wait to deal business with this CPK again. Thanks Clinton!

This is one of those places where I will never come back to. The host was really nice. But when it came to the waiter he seemed to rush us into our order.  My friend asked for a recommendation on a pizza and he made it seem as if the one we trusted him with was "phenomenon" when in reality it wasn't even great at all. The pasta was dry when it clearly said on the menu that it was "creamy."  And their 4.99 guacamole and chips is such a disappointment! I'm not a picky eater but I won't eat something that was in the making of a rush.
Went here twice during our week's stay in Hollywood. Nice outdoor seating with a view of the Hollywood sign. My personal favorite was the baked potato soup - yummy!  Wait staff was slow.

Seating: My friend and I were told to wait for 15-20 minutes at around 5:15 P.M. when we got there, yet actually waited for longer than that. I noticed how people who signed in later but were seated earlier than us.  Environment: Good lighting and green plants. I like the general atmosphere even though it could have been quieter. The background pop music did not really match my expectation, but since this is a family restaurant, I shouldn't expect too much.  Serving: We waited for about 10 to 15 minutes before a waiter came to us and took the order. Before he came, there was no waiter around in the area we were seated, and everyone else seemed so busy.  Food: The Avocado Egg Roll was good, but the Garlic Chicken Pizza was not impressive.  Overall: It was overall okay but I wouldn't say that this was a pleasant dining experience.

After being told that the patio was closed at Dave & Buster's we came here with loftier expectations. The hostess explained that only one side of the patio was open. Again? Geez, the show lets out we are a little humid because we are warm and we HOPE that some time in fresh air is available. That would be too perfect. Instead, we are forced to sit inside the bar. Our first inclination is to belly up but there are used plates and utensils strewn about. After standing there for a few minutes the bartender acknowledges our existence understanding some primping of the area in front of us is needed. We are standing for a few minutes MORE when we realize he has no intention of taking care of this issue quickly. We find a bar top and notice many tables with remnants of patrons past. Dirty dishes, food, glasses and so on. I hate to be prissy but this is Saturday FREAKIN' night and crowds are expected especially with it being a concert night.  Either the restaurant was improperly staffed or management was lacking BIGTIME!! Needless to say we had some time to kill with two bottles of Pinot from Buena Vista in Sonoma. I have to admit that I was livid and uncomfortable for a while until the infusion of fermented wine grapes relaxed me. Dontae' was our server and he was congenial and attentive. We have a CPK we love here in our neck of the desert but this is one I would avoid visiting in the future.

Came, expecting good things. No lag on seating time. :D Hostess seemed angry to see us. D: Server brought us no bread D: Server took 25 minutes to get to us. Normally would be fine if rush time, but this woman was genuinely doing her best to ignore us, it seemed. Maybe she had other stuff going on, but still a negative D: Food was also slightly disappointing: Mac and Cheese Balls were cold by the time they got to us, another 30 minutes after we ordered. Not particularly busy at any point tonight, mind you. D: Salad was good. :D BBQ chicken pizza had no corn. I am disappointed. D:
