im used to amazing food from CPK.  Disappointed 10X over.  we ordered 7 personal pizza's and they were all cold, dry, and rubbery crust.  Bland tasting.  Horrible horrible horrible!  I do recommend CPK.  I do NOT recommend this location.  Seriously, drive the extra couple miles to go to another location, heck I would drive 10 extra miles.  For the price you pay, you should get a fresh, hot, tasty pizza.  You will thank me.

First time eating at this CPK.  Came for a quick bite before the show.  We got seated quickly upon arrival.  Our server was really nice and foods were average.  Plenty of parking in the parking structure.  Restaurant does validate your parking so be sure to ask.  This is a busy location, situated right next to Starbucks shop.

I've always loved CPK in florida so decided to try it while I was visiting dolby theater in Hollywood. I was not disappointed! Very good service and food. Love the atmosphere on the patio overlooking the Hollywood sign

Stopped in at this CPK at 9PM after a 10-hour day of sightseeing in LA.  We were tired, our feed hurt and we were starving.  The hostess greeted us with a big smile and we were seated promptly.  She promised to take our aches and pains away and fill us with great food. Our waitress arrived promptly and took our drink order.  We each ordered two drinks, LoL, and said to bring water AFTER the drinks were gone.  We needed Al Cohol to ease away our tired feet and locked up back muscles. Drinks arrived and we downed the first set.  Then ordered.  One pizza, one chicken dish and one pasta dish.  Waitress asked if we wanted bread and in unison we all said, "YES!"  Three minutes later three loafs of hot, fresh out of the oven, Italian bread, appeared on our table. Salads arrived, excellent ... and a third round of drinks was delivered. Food arrived, excellent ... and a fourth round of drinks was delivered. Dessert.  Yes, we ordered dessert and a fifth round of drinks.  :-) Overall the experience was great, the servers were on point and on time, and the food was excellent even though we were starving and would have eaten bark off a tree at that point. In the end, five rounds of drinks were consumed with two on empty stomachs.  Thank goodness Uber was there to take us home to our hotel!

I used to like coming to this place but I'm sad to say it's no longer good.  The service was horrible the waiter didn't come at all to ask if we needed anything so I had to wave him down,I asked for some red chilli peppers, and he said "ok I'll be right over with them" 15 minutes passed and with only two slices left of pizza I wanted him down again and asked him "what happened with the red chilli peppers?"his response "their being washed" .  The pizza we ordered didn't seem to have any cheese on it when the waiter saw it he also agreed and offered us a free kids size pizza with plenty of cheese on it.  Do I need to go on?
We were seated immediately. It was 9 o'clock on a Friday evening. Dylan was our server and he was on top of things the whole way. The food was great! Very happy with our experience.

Elly is #1 makes my day seeing her sweet smile whenever I come into this location. I'm happy to be a regular here! Service always great and food is even better. Angel rocks also! They both make Cpk a beautiful place not just for families but solo too.

I'm not sure why all the negative comments but to each his own experience my experience was great! Don my server was a pro at the service game he was professional fun and helpful and all the staff I encountered were very nice and pleasant the jumbolya was well worth its pricecy indulgence and they have a butter cake that will put even most homemade poundcakes to shame ! I've never thought I could be so amazingly overwhelmed at cpk but it was great! ive be exhausted my eating out budget for the rest of the month but food and eating out is my only vice so I did it right !
Excellent Crunchy  Thai Salad. Ordered a medium rare Rib eye, but it cam med well. Still very good flavor,  just a little dry.
Slow slow slow slow.  Did I mention slow.   Wow, you would think for being at such a high profile high traffic place they would have their act together.
Great food and great service.  Ate at the bar and was served by Dallas!!!  He was awesome and did not miss one beat. Will definitely visit again when in Hollywood. Food was great!!!

I LOVE California Pizza Kitchen, but this specific location has the most awful service ever. My boyfriend and I decided to do take-out since we thought it'd be faster than sit-down. We waited at the Take Out station for maybe 10 minutes before anyone actually talked to us. But as I looked around there were a couple of servers standing at a table, talking and doing nothing, which really annoyed me. The bartender finally took our order and we waited maybe about 45 minutes for our food...and I just ordered pasta! My boyfriend's pizza finished 15 minutes before mine actually finished. We should've just stayed there to eat! It was ridiculous. Also, the people next to us complained about their food as well. Their chicken was cold and they forgot grapes for his salad. Clearly this specific CPK does not live up to the standards of the others.

As a former server I usually do not like throwing people under the bus, but this time I really need to make an exception. I have been to this location dozens of times and I've never been provided with such sub-par service. My friends and I all had crazy, long days of work, and the place was decently busy but we all had a hankering for our CPK favorites. We got seated, and as soon as Trenton walked up to us (after 15 minutes and only after my fiancé went over and complained to someone) we immediately knew we were in trouble. He was spaced out, sluggish, hard to communicate with, and we had to repeat our orders multiple times because every time he'd read them back it's all be wrong. He made us all extremely uncomfortable with the way he presented himself, and we all braced ourselves for what we knew would be a terrible meal. We didn't get drinks (or the water we requested) for ten plus minutes, and three other tables with people who'd arrived after us were getting their food. I approached Trenton about this and asked him if we could expect our food soon, as we had been waiting over thirty minutes and we hadn't seen him at all. He gave me a patronizing look, as if it were amusing, and made up a bunch of excuses I knew to be untrue. Over then next fifteen minutes he brought each of our dishes one at a time, and once it was all set down we didn't see him again for twenty more minutes. The whole time he moved slow as molasses and seemed to be extremely spaced out. My fiancé and I had not expected to be there so long, and we both had to be up for work at the crack of dawn and had to leave early. Those of you that have been to CPK know that the average turnaround time is no more than 40 minutes. We were there for nearly two hours. Like I said at the beginning, I was a server and used to get peeved when I got these kind of complaints, but I worked at a fine dining restaurant, and Trenton would've gotten the boot in less than a week. Rethink deploying Trenton during high volume nights, and possibly consider posting him as busboy.

Went to this restaurant in Hollywood and it was great!  The waitress was nice and very prompt with service.  The white corn guac with nachos is AMAZING. The margherita pizza with pepperoni is also A+.  I got their new honey strawberry with white wine mixed drink.  I can't remember the name of it unfortunately but that was sooooo good!  Probably one of the best fruity drinks I've ever had!  This CPK is great and I would totally return if I wasn't on vacation!!
Sure, there's a wait, but the pizza is delicious. Oh, and if your health is not something you're too concerned about, I highly recommend the fried mac n cheese.

We decided to dine at CPK before the Hollywood Bowl concert. I had the chicken piccatta while my husband ordered the Salmon. We also ordered soup: baked potato. The soup was good. The entrees were delicious. The waiter was nice and attentive to our needs. We will definitely return soon.
I love it here have the avocado egg rolls the CA club pizza or the chipotle spicy chicken pizza and the butter cake!!!!

boyfriend and i had the lunch special while waiting for AGT taping. we thought it was a great deal and although it was filling i would probably spend the extra money and order an entree. the sandwich was mehhh. too much bread & too little meat. the pizza lunch special was also more bread and tasted alright. i didn't feel like it was delicious, just made me full that's all. ALSO, do not sit on the outside patio area if you do not want to be attacked by bees. Not to mention, they forgot to give us our complimentary bread and it took about 15 minutes before we were able to get our waitress to bring us our bread because apparently other waiters/waitresses can't help. OH YEAH, while on the waiting topic, it took them almost an hour to make our food...uhh we just had one sandwich and one small pizza....then our waitress says "your order got lost in their pile" umm okay? and what did they do for us after that? nothing....

Stumbled across this place as its close to our hotel. Good pizza with good pizza base (I'm really picky with base) our waiter gave us a free starter as it was our first visit and gave really good service! Would go back again!

The server that we had was great he was attentive even though it was a busy Friday night. But the food was awful. Over the years the quality of CPK has declined, ever since they started selling frozen pizza in the grocery store it all tastes manufactured.

I'm usually a fan of CPK but this location had the worst service. Our waiter gave us 3 bread crumbs while the tables around us (with the same party size) got decent sized bread plates. I'm a bread lover so YES I care and it matters. Food took forever to come out and my moms salad was forgotten so she had to eat our pizza first then have her salad after the fact which is totally not the right order. She asked for a refill twice and was ignored. I was tempted to get up and pour it myself. Even asking for the check and paying was a long drawn out process. I couldn't help but wonder if we were being ignored on purpose- like did we remind him of someone he had strongly disliked in a previous life? Was he taking it out us? Whatever the issue, I will not be returning and will choose another establishment to go to pre- Hollywood bowl concert.
I loved the service! Jason the guy who took my order was awesome! He even had some funny jokes! The British manager Go was Vee y sweet also! I really enjoyed the carne as Ada pizza! It was bomb!

I stopped into California Pizza Kitchen after a show. The halibut dinner exceeded my expectations. The fish was fresh and moist. The Faro risotto with butternut squash was topped with asparagus, and both were so delicious. I loved it so much that I emailed CPK and asked for the recipe. I also really like that the menu gives you wine suggestions to go with the meal. The place was only a little busy, and it is a good place to go to after you have seen a live performance in the Hollywood and Highland complex.

I think CPK is pretty damned good. Across the board, their food is tasty, and their service is good.  The review could easily end there, but if you're picky, read: I understand when people find me difficult to please. And while all of their staff does a good job, I'm particularly grateful for the hostess, Mary, who always deals with all the little requests and nuances of my order and does it with a sincere smile. To the management, and from one employer to another -- if you fail to acknowledge talent you're likely to lose it. My recommendation would be to make her a server. Your customers deserve her level of service -- and she in turn, deserves a position which is paid for their level of performance, not just attendance.  Please know, I don't personally know her nor do I have any ulterior motive. I merely know first hand the importance of advancing deserving people.
The classic crispy chicken half sandwich was dry and tough and the chicken size was tiny.

For the record I love CPK but I am done with this location. I've given them at least a dozen chances and each time I order and go pick up or get delivery something is missing or the order is completely wrong. So tonight I placed my order at 6:45 and it's 9:35 and I still haven't eaten. It took 2 hours to deliver me something I didn't even order and now I'm waiting for what I did order. I'm just done with you. Done.
Awesome customer service with Abbie, Gaurav the manager, Abel,  & Jose the host- outside the front door!

Lots of different thin crust pizzas. If you're looking for a little different, instead of just a cheese or pepperoni pizza this place is for you. There are a lot of these Cal Pizza locations throughout the South bay. You won't be disappointed. Reasonable priced pizza.

I tried to call for carry out here and couldn't understand anyone on the phone. I checked the menu beforehand and couldn't find sides to order anywhere on it so I asked the person in the phone to which he spewed off so fast I had no idea. I hung up to look at the actual website menu for this location and wanted to get a baked potato and salad-AS LISTED. So when I call back, they don't have baked potatoes?!? Done, waste of time and probably wouldn't get the order right anyway

I appreciate CPK in Hollywood for the quick resolution to my past awful experience. Within days of my Yelp review the CPK Corporate office reached out to me and had the manager reach out to me as well. It is nice to see a chain restaurant who cares about there customers. While I won't change my original review, the customer service at CPK deserves 5 stars.
Stable neighborhood Italian. Like the petite wedge, Thai chicken pizza & cedar plank salmon

My wife is gluten free, they have a small menu to cater to her sensitivity! The hostess Mary was very pleasant and answered questions we had asked and gave us waters as we waited for our server. Once seated we were greeted by Brenna who took our order and gave us bread. Herbert was nice enough to clear our table for us as we waited for our bill. They worked really well as a team to make sure our needs were met! Great BBQ pizza! They also have a great lunch deal with a 7" pizza and soup or salad. Definitely will be coming back!
My favorite place in Hollywood! You need to try "The original barbecue pizza" ... nothing better than that ... great atmosphere, nice people and amazing location.

Update of my review::: After posting about my past experience at this location, the manager was extra nice and reached out to help resolve the issue. I've never seen a restaurant be so concerned about a customer who had a bad experience at their place. It really did surprise me. I would definitely come to this location again because of the excellent effort their staff has shown me. Thank you.  ---------------------------------- Of course the food is good at CPK, but I'm writing this review because the customer service for this location was horrible. Our waiter was nice but we sat outside and we were forgotten. It wasn't even that busy. We got ONE cup of water the entire time. No one checked on us, and when I asked for the check, we had to wait half an hour because no one would bring it out. Ridiculous.
This place is so friendly and has good food I always have the crispy chicken sandwich off the hook. Try it out
Great staff and location. Food was not the best and expensive. Seemed mass produced and certainly not fresh.

I've been eating a lot of CPK and they have changed from years ago. Came here for a dinner after walking around and being a tourist around Hollywood.  They give you bread and the dipping sauce is so tasty. For appetizers we ordered two which was avocado with chips and avocado deep fried rolls. I've been on a binge on eating lots of avocado. It's pretty tasty but the portion size for the avocado and chips is really small. Ordered a Thai pizza and a salad. There are plenty of options for pizza and salad. They are popular for pizza so I would suggest order a pizza.  It is a lot of carbs so I would say if you aren't a diet than this place is pretty alright.  Tip: Sign up for CPK rewards program online to get points for every time you dine, just tell your server your email address or phone number and they can put it in the system.

The consummate California gourmet pizza eatery.   High energy atmo, with an open kitchen, cozy booths, attentive wait staff and the requisite bus boy with a spec script he wants u to take a look at.  Everything's in season all year long in California, so you're safe with anything on the menu. Its so LA, you feel like you're in NYC. Orders can be placed for carry-out.   Arik Katzenberg April 1, 2017

Incredible service and excellent pizza. We were pleasantly surprised to find such a great pizza place with wine that surpasses fine dining restaurants. And our waiter, Josue, was brilliant and courteous with a manner that you would expect from an upscale restaurant. It's the food that matters but what distinguishes ordinary places from extra-ordinary is the attention to detail, the pleasant smile and welcoming attitude. I think Josue shows this and, to be honest, all (yes all) other folks we met in this exquisite city of Los Angeles show this in their humbling 'welcome to my city' persona. To all the folks in this great city that care, thank you.

Our waiter Trenton, introduced himself as our waiter and indicated that he would need to make some deliveries.  I asked if we could put in our order, which he said no because he has to deliver some food.   Um, okay. So we waited and waited and waited.  Trenton never returned - never.  We saw him at other neighboring tables, except ours. Instead, the host who had seated us, took our order and returned multiple of times.  The bartender, also assisted by delivering food and taking our dessert request.  They really went out of their way, and we are very thankful.  There was a mix-up with our food, which caused our food to be delayed.  Instead of a bbq chicken children's pizza, we received the hawaiian.  This error was taken off our bill.   I wish there was a comment card to fill out, which I would have given praise to the host and the bartender who assisted us very graciously.   I wish I had gotten their names.  I'm not sure if they are part of management, or if they just went out of their way.   Either way, to the host and bartender, thank you for an enjoyable dining experience.  Five stars for your generosity and hospitality. Four stars for the restaurant as they seemed understaffed.

It seems that if you want to work at the California pizza kitchen you have to be a gentleman with a bun. My guest and I were commenting on how many of the employees had their hair in a bun we found it quite entertaining. The food is overpriced and under flavored. Spaghetti Bolognese was a small portion and it was very dry seemed like it had been created almost like a cookie-cutter fast food recipe approach no passion. The pizza had mushrooms that were bad tasting & on the verge of being just bad as in rotting and my guest suffered stomach issues for the rest the day afterward. I tasted the pizza and then quickly realized the mushrooms that were on the pizza were not fresh.  I hate giving bad reviews but this place is going BUNDER.  I was going to give three stars... but my guest said no two!

Simply put, great service and very pleasant people. BBQ chicken chopped salad is the way to go. The spicy chicken chipotle pizza is honestly the best thing I've had in a while. You can do curbside pick up for your convenience. The food is typically ready in 15 minutes!!! Love you guys.

Delicious pizzas but also fantastic soups & salads! Never been here for dinner but love this place for lunch, it can be a bit expensive, but worth it. During the week it's easier to get seated, and waited on. Everyone's meal was completely devoured.

Service was great. There is a lot of parking but make sure you validate your ticket. I was there for about 3 hours and I had to pay $5 with validation. I tried the shrimp Scampi pasta because it was listed under favorites... it was not good! Lol I was with two other people and they tried it and agreed. It had absolutely no flavor and the portion was small. That plate is not worth $15.99 and it's not worth being under the favorites on the menu. We also got the Carne Adada pizza. This is a new pizza and it was surprisingly good. I tried all the lemonades they have ( they are refillable) my favorite one was the Peach flavor
Loved this place! The service was excellent and we had an amazing Bbq chicken pizza. The price is very reasonable as well. We will be back again.

Sounds silly, but this is easily one of my favorite date spots. My boyfriend and I almost always sit at the bar where we get seated and served very quickly, split a bottle of wine, and enjoy good food and conversation. The close proximity to the Chinese Theater as well as the rest of Hollywood Blvd. makes it an ideal place to start a night on the town. Highly recommend!
Horrible service. We usually love cpk and the menu options but this location has the worst service.  Rude.
I had margarita pizza and strawberry and mango cooler, pizza tasted good when it is hot, a lot of cheese on it. Service is good as well.
Said they took my takeout order but had no record of it when I arrived to pick it up.

I stopped in and had A hard time choosing  What to eat because  The selection was  Fantastic!  Ended up choosing  The pasta and pizza . It was delicious! Our waiter Mohammed Showed excellent  Customer service skills  By being courteous, Checking up on us frequently , And he was prompt on  Bringing our orders out . Manager came around and  Asked how everything was. If you are looking for great Service and food try  California pizza kitchen on Hollywood Blvd.

Food was okay went during lunch time and our server was just not friendly. It was our first time there and our host said we could get something free I forgot what she said. But our server didn't mention anything. Overall food was mediocre. View from outside was gorgeous can see the Hollywood sign.

3.5 Stars. Went here for dinner after a day of fun with the family in Hollywood. Wanted to eat somewhere a bit different but since we had the whole family we decided to  choose a sure thing, and it paid off. My wife hit the gluten free pizza and I got a sausage, pepperoni and mushroom pizza. We both enjoyed the pizzas very much.  Service was good and overall it was a good experience. Great place to go to get a good meal that won't break the bank.

This place was a total joke. The waitstaff and servers do not have leadership or training that enable them to be able to deal with the amount of volume of traffic this place gets. They will basically take in the most frustrated or inpatient people before the people who wait their turn. I guess they get so much business that they don't really have to strive for excellence. We called ahead with a large group and were told 30 minutes. When we checked in at the desk we were told 10 minutes. An hour and a half later with many many check ins, we were still not seated. We continued to ask for a ballpark time so we can adjust our plans. We were finally told that were next.  Then, a group of the same size as ours get seated before us! I walked up to tell the server that we were there much longer waiting before. One of the ladies in the party looks to me and says a racist comment about how Caucasian people are always sat before her race and how this restraint is racist if they don't seat them next. Then they are seated. I talk to the manager and asked why they were seated and he said because they made a racist comment pulled the "race card" and they had to protect the restaurant.  Anyway I thought it was ridiculous and we ended up all getting split up because they couldn't accommodate us after that. I think the whole issue was handled very unprofessional and I actually feel bad for the staff because they just seemed overwhelmed and stressed. They seriously need some leadership help at this place...,

Lesson learned... DO NOT order steak at a pizza place. It looked so good on the menu photo so I figured.. why not? Normally when you price a steak that high, it should come out good. It was totally undercooked. I said medium rare and it was basically cut off the cow and just warmed up. They had to throw it back on. The flavor wasn't very good. The worst part was the hard fat all through steak. Half of it was not even edible. I never should have paid for that. Very disappointed.

A great CPK location in Hollywood. I will say I hardly come here, not a fan of Hollywood, but we came on a Saturday night around 9 and got sat right away.  Decided to try something new and got the banh mi bowl, which was quinoa, baby kale, grilled chicken, watermelon radishes, fresh avocado, cucumbers, and a few other items.   It was pretty tasty, as was their bread.  Sadly they do oil now and not the butter, but the bread is still good.

I actually came here few weeks ago and I forgot to review this place. I had a HORRIBLE experience because there was basically ZERO service. The waiter came to our table saying he was our server for a day. He was no where to be seen after he got our orders for a drink and our order for the food. We were about to order our food but he was NOWHERE to be seen. I could see just WALKING AROUND DOING NOTHING. I couldn't get his attention so I asked someone else. It was a young lady and she said she will get him for us. We ordered the food but AGAIN he gave ZERO F about us. I could clearly see him so he never clocked out. I was not able to get his attention. He walks by us and I called his name. He just walks pass by us casually. HORRIBLE SERVICE. The same young lady got our food for us. I wanted a refill of my drink but I couldn't because more people came in and it was just impossible to ask for a drink to different waiter/waitress. It was a DISASTER. By the way it wasn't even that busy when we came here. A lot of people but not that many to forget who you are serving.  I have been to multiple CPK and correct me if I am wrong but does this CPK let you walk in and out from the kitchen? Because they clearly give ZERO F and don't care what you need. It is IMPOSSIBLE to ask for more water. WATER! For those who is going to come here, I think you can walk in and grab anything you want from the kitchen. There aren't any servers so no one cares. Just don't bother the chefs. You don't want to distract them from making mediocre food.  Food: 3/5 Service: 0/5

Came here after a long absence.  The last time I was at this specific location was like 10 years ago.  And being at a CPK in general was probably a year.  I ordered the half soup of split pea and barely and potato chowder.  Plus we ordered the shishito peppers which were yum and also a protein bowl which was good.  Loved everything.  It tasted like we remembered it so it's nice locations are consistent.  Sometimes a non fancy meal is what you need.  Also enjoyed the free bread and the sauce it came with.  No line when we arrived, but it was packed and the A/C is strong so bring a jacket even though it is summer.  It was pretty cold inside.  Service was friendly and nice.  This is a big location with tons of indoor and outdoor seating.
My family always choose CPK....great selections but we have to wait long for the food to be served and we have to ask for the bread, before they give it prior to ordering :(
I found a blonde hair in my waldorf salad. Nice friendly waiter, but where's the bread?  Ok, bread just arrived but  we're done with the  meal.
Going to a good restaurant is good but having an awesome waiter is better! Big kudos to Abbie, our waiter she made us feel right at home !

We dropped in late after a Hollywood movie premiere so it was busy busy busy. But that didn't stop the concierge greeting everyone, kids included, and he didn't miss opening the door for anyone coming into the restaurant all night. We had a fantastic waiter who was engaging and aware of when to hover and when to move on. The food was excellent and we were surprised by the quality wine selection. All in all a great place for a casual but quality meal.

Came in here yesterday with my family and my service dog. The Hispanic hostess in the front demanded to see an ID for my dog. My dog had a service vest on that we purchased, although everyone knows there's really no proper identification or vest required. We told her we didn't have one because we aren't required to show that by law. I understand that maybe because she's unfamiliar with how the system works, she could refuse to seat us inside. What bothered me the most was the fact that she and her coworkers were pointing fingers and snickering at us. If you don't know proper law, educate yourself. Even if we were in the wrong, we are still customers and don't deserve to be treated like that

Excellent customer service! It was my cousin's first time at CPK, let alone Hollywood & Highland! The wait staff was very attentive and gave us a free appetizer!  The waiter also gave us tips on how to make the most of our meal! So great. Thanks CPK!

Me and my girlfriend came in today and we got one of the best waiter he name is Abel really nice guy and very attentive and even suggested a few thing thanks.The food was very good and the pasta too will be back !

I arrived with a large party on a busy weekend afternoon. The hostess was nice and gave us quote time and stuck to it. Our server was amazing - despite being really busy he made sure to always check in on us and gave us plenty of attention. There was a small mishap with one of our dishes but the server and manager were very polite about it and quick to fix the problem. I was very pleasantly surprised by the great customer service that we received. The food was also very yummy!

We had a great server here by the name of Abel. What a fantastic job he did. Very attentive to our family. I'm giving this place a three star only because the host Vanessa in my opinion is not the right person to be hosting this establishment. Poorly trained and inpatient. The Rolling of her eyes very unprofessional. We sat outside with our family and saw her do that to multiple people. Might want to look into that California Pizza Kitchen.

Let me start off by saying... I have been to CPKs before and I have had a much better experience than what we had last night.  It was slow for a Sunday night and basically everything else around was already closed. We got out of seeing A Goofy Movie at El Cap and wanted some dinner. We walked across the street and found CPK. The hostess stand out front was empty but had a sign telling us to "See Hostess for Seating". In my mind that is telling me to go inside the restaurant and find the hostess or anyone to find a table. The three of us walk in and IMMEDIATELY the hostess comes around the corner to accost us. She tells us that we were supposed to be waiting outside and the sign told us so. I told her no the sign told us to see the hostess so I came to find you. She was very rude and just pointed to a table and gave us some menus and had us sit there. She didn't even walk us to the table. I wish I had gotten her name because I wanted to make sure someone knew about it with every last detail but after that she was no where to be seen for the rest of the night.  Our waitress was friendly and took our drink order right away and when we ordered food the food came out quick. The place was very slow compared to all the hustle and bustle outside on the street at Hollywood blvd. The food was okay just as it always is. I think at the later hour that it was we just wanted something to eat rather than fight the crowds down on the sidewalks to find something better to eat. It was also weird to me that we were eating at 9:30 at night and a lot of restaurants closed at 10pm even in one of the busiest parts of LA. I will have to say though that experience makes to not have great feelings about returning to a CPK, rude staff, bland pizza, and a menu that I haven't seen changes in a long time. Also there was no bread given. The last CPK I went to in Honolulu gave us bread before our meal.

I Come Here At Least Once A Week. The Lunch Specials Are Good, The Drinks & Food Are Delicious & The Staff Is Friendly. They Have A Reward Program So It Makes It Easy To Get Free Appetizers. They Validate For Parking & They Don't Ever Have A Long Wait!

The service and the quality of food are wildly inconsistent. I live in Hollywood so I have been here many times over the years but finally decided that I didn't want to run the risk of being unpleasantly surprised anymore.

Okay, so it's literally across the street from my residence. I've been going off and on for years & I've had 30-40% of the menu selections; I can't remember any complaints in the past as far as quality, freshness, temperature, or presentation of the dish.  Their oven for pizza baking is interestingly interesting, so say the least. Prices are fairly reasonable; managers are active on the floor & from time to time will introduce themselves to the seated guests when duty hasn't solicited them elsewhere.  The only thing that really set me off with the pay system at this establishment is at the bottom of the receipt it breaks down the tipping amount based on one's individual tab in increments of 15, 18, & 20%. Again, that's based on the cost of the tab & is quite helpful as far as illuminating one having to calculate.  The problem is they base tip recommendations on the entire tab (including the tax) and that's not supposed to be.  EXAMPLE: if my meal total is $5 & with tax it's $5.45  the tip recommendation chart of 15, 18, or 20%, is supposed to be on the $5, not the $5.45. Where is it written that we're supposed to tip tax?  Please tell me because I do stand to be corrected if I'm wrong. But the tax wasn't served to me on a plate nor did the tax give me service, so why should I tip a tab whose total includes the tax? Yes, the $5 is taxable, hence the $5.45, but the $5 alone is what I'm supposed to tip (if I choose), not the $5.45.  I brought it to the attention of my waiter who was working the bar that particular day, but it was kinda' shrugged off as if it was nonexistent. I don't think anyone has ever challenged it or paid any attention to it, but I caught the subliminal trick of mild robbery. gain, I stand to be corrected; each one teach one and I strive to learn something new every day.

300! I've been holding off on my 300th review for something extraordinary.  THIS was simply AMAZING. My family and I were heading over to see Janet in concert (Miss Jackson if ya nasty) at the Hollywood bowl. We left ourselves ample time to eat here and walk over to the bowl, which was about 2 hours and some change. We waited 30 mins for a table. We get in, order, and pay the check immediately so we wouldn't have to wait at the end, and we could just head to the concert fast. We ordered drinks (there were only 3 of us) and waited. Drinks come. We start noticing though that people around us are being sat... and are eating, but our food has yet to make an entrance. This is after like 30 mins of waiting. We ask our waitresses what's going on with our order, and she goes to "check". We wait... from my brothers vantage point, he can see her in the kitchen, so of course i turn around to look.  She's arguing with the chef. Someone lost the order ticket. NO FOOD WAS COMING! Omfg!  We asked to see a manager. Now we legit have to sit though a 2 hour concert STARVING. We can't even believe it, but think for sure the manager is going to fix things. Here he comes... with a bill! "Sorry guys. Sometimes things like this happen." Then he hands my boyfriend a bill... "what's THIS?" "Oh sorry ya, your drinks weren't added to the bill you pre paid. I refunded it, but not the drinks". ARE. YOU. FUCKING. SERIOUS? I've never experienced this in all my life. Lol... you would think with such a HUGE fuck up, they'd offer a gift card? Drinks on the house?  Something?  Nah... and YES the waitress knew we were going to the concert. Never eat here. Horrible NON SERVICE.

A hit or a miss. The food is good but the service can either be good or terrible.  FOOD: The pizzas are generally good and can be shared between 2 people. My favorite is the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza.  Their salads are good as well.  MUST TRY: Definitely get the sangria flight! You get three different kinds of sangria with fruit. Sooo good!  It is something I order every time I'm there.  SERVICE: This location is in Hollywood. So there is usually a flow of customers. But even after being seated by the hostess, it was so hard to get the server's attention to even order. During some visits, the servers don't come so I have to ask the hostess to get our server. In the end, the hostess just took our order and served us instead. (Thanks girl, you da VIP) Tips: Parking is usually validated ($2.00 for 2 hours) BUT IF YOU PARK AFTER 10PM, YOU HAVE TO PAY A FLAT RATE OF $15.00! This is even if you came a few minutes before 10pm, apparently (i.e. 9:55pm). So keep this in mind.
Atmosphere was great!! Prices are fairly reasonable if you pay on your own. Its a great place to split with a friend! The food was very good. The waitress i had was very nice!

Update: I've changed this to one star because I have since had a reaction to that pizza, so it was contaminated with gluten somehow. Luckily I don't have a life-threatening allergy, but for anyone who does, avoid this place. -- Got the gluten-free Margherita pizza to-go. Crust was burnt. Cheese was tasteless. Barely any tomatoes, about 5 small pieces on the entire pizza. Giving this two stars instead of one only because the employees were courteous and accommodating with my allergy and the basil on the pizza was the right amount. I'm not one to leave bad reviews because I'm not very picky but overall the pizza was bad and horribly overpriced ($20!!) Definitely not coming back to this location.
Good pizza and pasta. When you enter you get some bread with oil to eat as appetizer. We tried the BBQ pizza and the pesto pasta, after the lunch we were full!

Fantastic and fresh food, the pizzas fresh and made right in front of you.  You can order a little bit of things other than pizza and there is a large selection of toppings. If you go too much, you will end up ordering the same thing. Great place overall.

its my first time here food was good and my server her name Brooke she did really good job but i was sorry that she have to handle with bad family who really too much next to my table i wish you have a good day

Unbelievably lousy.  Can't make a pizza correctly.  It's in the name of the chain and yet 3 tries, they can't get it right.  Plus they try to pass of a NY strip as a ribeye.  I know it's a pizza place but I've had the ribeye at a few other locations and it's really good.  They "comp'd" our meal but since nobody ate anything, what's the point?  Brooke was our server and she was absolutely terrible.  Horrific.  Pure crap.

We went to order take out for the first time on our way home from Runyon.  We figured we order something healthy since we just got back from our hike.  I ordered the banh mi power bowl and my fiancé ordered the Santa Fe power bowl.  We were looking forward to enjoy our lunch since we were super hungry.  When we opened the box, we were disappointed to see 5 whimpy pieces of chicken.  $14.99 is not a lot of money but it is over priced for the quality that you get.  I should've made my own salad at home instead.  Never again.
Had to wait awhile for a table, well worth the wait.  Friendly service, great food.  Love their lemon drop martinis.  Steak cooked to perfection.  Recommend the Waldorf salad
Always good and consistent! With ppl that work there i can say they are not the smartest but the food comes out pretty fast so I'm ok with it i guess everything is good

This rating is based on the service we experienced. Late last month, myself and a party we're waiting for a table during the late afternoon and was told by the hostess that the wait would be about 20 minutes. So we outside with the other parties that were also waiting to be seated. After 15 minutes, we checked to see how far on the list we would be seated with the second hostess. We then noticed some guy go over the fence into the outside patio, waved his friends over to sit at an empty table, and then sat down. Rather than the hostess asking them to leave and wait like the everyone else, he brought their menus and had a waiter come to take their order. Several of us were upset that he allowed this to happen. One of my friends then went inside to see if they were that busy as both hostesses claimed. He said there were eight empty (cleaned and set) tables inside. When he came back out, he told the first hostess (the one that put us on the waitlist) about it and she said we still had to wait. Mind you within 20 minutes we were waiting, only two parties were seated and several more still waiting. This restaurant clearly has poor communication with its staff and needs improvement in order to provide better service for their customers.
